description: fedora 27 - not working
I don't see any reason to pay a third-party to use a service I already pay for.

People saying that this app is bad because it requires a subscription are having the dumb. It would be up to Google/Microsoft to release a Google Drive/OneDrive client for Linux but they won't so Insync is addressing that need. Should they go to Google/Microsoft and demand that they pay Insync's salaries? Seriously if you don't have something constructive to say then shut up.
summary: Still one of the best options

description: Use it on all my win/mac/linux machines
summary: Great app. Use it on all my win/mac/linux machines

description:
After an initial successful sync with Office365 Business (~100GB with 2 Sharepoint sites), two events caused me to uninstall after 24 hours of testing:

 - One file repeatedly was flagged as having an invalid checksum, even after changing the file's contents online.
- After trying to upload a file, the whole local sharepoint folder vanished

These two events showed that the file syncing is not robust enough to guarantee no data loss.

On a positive note, it is the only application on Linux to support OneDrive Sharepoints and it has a great UI. Hope it gets better in future releases.
Ran high CPU for 24 hours, sent no data, wasn't able to sync anything from my home folder. Very disappointing having paid for the full license.

I bought the Insync and updated to its latest version.
I have Insync in my Linux machine and Google Drive in my Mac and Windows machines.
Insync simply does not work properly.
It duplicates files and delete others (randomly?) after you back up your files by Google Drive.
too lag for ubuntu 18.04
I will not pay for a a service like this
summary: Works... but you need to pay

description: Yes it's a one time purchase software (no subscription) but not free and not open source. I looked for Open Source software to do what Insync does but could find any that worked the way I needed. Insync works and works well. I've been running it on Ubuntu 16.04 and 18.04 without issue. It's interface is simple and easy to use and it keeps my files sync with Google Drive.
Often gets stuck uploading files, uses 100% CPU for long periods of time, and the forums are full of people reporting data loss.
summary: Would not buy again, often gets stuck and I don't feel my data is safe

description: Gran app que permite sincronizar de forma simple he intuitiva tu gdrive de varias cuentas de forma sencilla en max/win/linux. El precio a pagar es accesible, incluso en Argentina (o pillé una oferta?! no lo recuerdo), ya que se realiza un pago "único" y luego sigues teniendo soporte y actualizaciones de forma permanente. He empleado esta App desde hace unos 3 años y ha sobrevidido a varias versiones de Ubuntu/Debian en diferentes dispositivos (también la he empleado en windows y en una macbookpro).

Nice Sycn app for Linux and other OS. 
I used it in my ubuntu 18.04 to sycn with my other device for my google drive. 
Pay once for lifetime.
The interface is good. Worth it for me for the price for now.
Hope the dev keep the good work

When it works, it's very useful. However, I have had it delete files on my local drive in very unexpected ways. And now I can't seem to launch it at all after installing an update. Tried to contact support, but it seems they only work during business hours in Singapore, which is not much use here in North America...
summary: Great when it works, scary when it doesn't..

description: Works well for me. No setup or operational issues that I am currently aware of. The UI & UX are well polished and complete.
summary: Works well for me (18.04 LTS - Desktop)

description: We need this app for thousand files, because there is no else another app. It works good.
Payed for the Developer version. $60 Ill never get back. The customer support team does not respond to messages. DO NOT BUY THIS APP!
summary: Not Working with Fedora 34 DO NOT BUY!

description: Simply a great app and a must if you use Google Drive.
summary: A must if you have Drive

description: It's very frustrating. at least for medium to large workloads. It can only sync for less than an hour with Google Drive. File indexing is painfully slow. Tokens get invalid after only a few minutes (even with the alternative login option). CS is slow to respond and left me hanging with pointless questions even as I sent all the required files. Just don't bother with this. Try RClone instead.
I sync multiple clouds between multiple devices, and can montor everything easy.
summary: Dropox, GDrive sync as they should

description:
Tolles Programm funktioniert super,
aber man muss viel Geld dafür zahlen
La mejor alternativo en Linux, para el cliente de Google Drive.
Pas fiable, beaucoup de bugs
зависла система 18.04 может кому больше повезло. удаляю. нестабильно.
